messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: Jason Rogers
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> > >One of the disadvantages to this is that it makes it a
> > little harder to
> > have
> > >that solitary project that will be responsible to run [...]
> > I'm not sure I understand your point. Can you explain?

>A difference of style here. We have all of our individual tests compiled
>into some TestSuite. We then include all of those test suites into the
>AllTests package in the AllTests project. Our buildSuite() method becomes
>just a few lines of code, referencing all of the other project suites
(whose
>buildSuite() methods are also short and sweet, including only the classes
>for that package). But it seems you have stepped around this by
>programmatically loading every test case in the workspace. Do you also
load
>the JUnit test cases (e.g. MoneyTest)?

No. I skip over them. Can be done with project name or package name. See
below. Again, TSTTCPW.

Code of collectTests():
com.ibm.ivj.util.base.Workspace workspace =
com.ibm.ivj.util.base.ToolEnv.connectToWorkspace();
com.ibm.ivj.util.base.Type testCaseType =
workspace.loadedTypeNamed("junit.framework.TestCase");
com.ibm.ivj.util.base.Type testCases[] = testCaseType.getAllSubtypes();
int i = 0;
while (i < testCases.length) {
if (testCases[i].getName().indexOf("$") == -1) { //skip over inner classes
if (testCases[i].getQualifiedName().indexOf("junit") != 0) { //skip junit
tests.
try { [...]

> > I use the VAJ toolapi to extract automatically all tests
> > to be run (see
> > below code. Not perfect code, but it's TSTTCPW). They can
> > easily be packaged
> > in another JAR if needed (with ant for example).
>How do you do this outside of VAJ using the Tools API?

The code i've sent generates a normal AllTest class usable outside VAJ.

> > collectTests() will find every TestCase subclass in the
> > workspace. I have a
> > ant script that loads the latest release stuff before
> > running this.
>When you say "loads", you mean it loads into VAJ?

Yes. Ant as optionnal tasks for this (VAJLoad, see
http://jakarta.apache.org/ant/manual/Integration/VAJAntTool.html)
I written a small modification to load the "latest" stuff since we are using
rolling project baselines. (i.e. open editions)

> > mention is that it's very easy to keep versions in sync
> > (tests & code). If
> > you have two projects, you can end up runnning old tests
> > on newer classes,
>We don't encounter this problem since the tests projects map one-to-one
with
>the production code projects, as well as the packages within them. I guess
>I dont' quite comprehend how this could happen.

I tought that if one has the following structure :
Project A v1, package B v1 , class C v1

Project TA v1 package TB v1 package T v1, test class TC v1

Now you work on class C, and adjust the tests of class TC, but then you
forget to version&release TC, or TB or the tester gets the latest release
content for project A but not for project TA. Don't you end up running test
case v1 against code version 2?


mathieu
